title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 June 2016 - XWiki
content:
<xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has joined #xwiki  
00:30 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> hey guys, can anyone help me with a fresh xwiki install deb based ubuntu 14 LTS?  
00:30 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> the website wont show after install with tomcat saying 404  
00:52 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:54 <vmassol> has quit  
00:54 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has quit  
02:56 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
02:57 <vmassol> has quit  
03:19 <confusedcylon> has joined #xwiki  
03:20 <confusedcylon> Hi all, can someone tell me which permission it is that adds the + sign? I'm trying to apply permissions to create pages in a space and all its children. A test user in the relevant group I'm applying to, upon logging in is shown an edit button and administer - but no add.  
03:46 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
04:23 <M-oren> i installed xwiki on ubuntu 15.10 using apt-get. i go to http://localhost:8080/xwiki and after 10 minutes i see this: http://paste.ubuntu.com/17349431/ - Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space  
04:31 <confusedcylon> your jvm needs more meory

09:46 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <Evi\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <Evi\_> Hi! What happens if I rename the /xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome page? I wanna change the 'welcome message'?  
09:58 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <ClemensR> Evi\_: you can just edit that page, I think  
10:38 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <ClemensR> if you move the page, the include macro might be broken ATM, but you can edit the Dashboard to fix it  
10:39 <ClemensR> but there is not need to rename the page, you can just change the page title  
10:40 <Evi\_> @ClemensR: Isn't renaming the page and chaning the page title the same?  
10:40 <ClemensR> no  
10:40 <ClemensR> renaming changes the page name,  that is a special action you select from the drop down  
10:41 <ClemensR> chaning the title is what you do in the normal editor  
10:41 <ClemensR> and these are actually two different things, unlike e.g. MediaWiki  
10:42 <Evi\_> Changing the title of this special page doesn't work in the normal editor, cause it is named '$services.localization.render('xe.home.title')'. But it is not that important. I guess I leave everything as it is. I'm afraid to damage something.  
10:44 <Enygma`> Evi\_: a page has a field called "title" that you can change in edit mode. Renaming or moving a page is the operation that changes the location where the page is stored, i.e. changes the parent of a page (for move) or changes the name of the resource/document holding the page (rename).  
10:44 <ClemensR> ah, it is a translation key ... well, you can just override that if you do not want the translation. this time it will not break anything, promised :)  
10:45 <Enygma`> when creating a new page, it is by convention that the new page name is the same as the title you input, but the 2 (title and name) can be different.  
10:47 <Evi\_> thank you very much, ClemensR and Enygma. I understand a little bit better now. Maybe I override the translation then.  
10:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <Evi\_> Sorry to disturb you again. I've installed the full calendar macro. It works. But how can I add events?  
11:12 <evalica> Evi\_: you need to add a Calendar Application, not the Macro. The Apps use the Macro. Try Mocca Calendar or another Calendar app.  
11:16 <ClemensR> I have tried to reproduce the issue of the person on the mailing list who gets URL-encoded page titles, but cannot reproduce it the the jetty-hsql setup, so it seems to be something tomcat specific  
11:24 <Evi\_> ok, thx, evalica. I've installed full calendar macro and mocca calendar app. Now, I want to display the calendar macro on a special page, including the events of the mocca calendar. How can I do this?  
11:26 <evalica> :) not sure why you want to display them somewhere else and not use the Mocca Application for that. Anyway, I'll let you find the joy in figuring it out :P Make sure to read the documentation page on extensions.xwiki.org about the Full Calendar Macro.  
11:30 <ClemensR> I guess one can use the {{moccacal /}} macro for that, that is just the content of the start page  
11:30 <ClemensR> the start page of the moccacal application  
11:31 <ClemensR> so the MoccaCalendar has its own macro, because using the full calender macro for that is possible, but not documented  
11:31 <ClemensR> (huh, the moccacal macro is not documented either on the extension page, or is it? ...)  
11:32 <ClemensR> nah, I forgot to document it, sorry  
11:32 <Evi\_> Clemens, I don't think that it is documentet. May you explain me what I can do?  
11:33 <ClemensR> I have to look this up myself ...  
11:34 <Evi\_> ok, thx for your help.  
11:35 <ClemensR> yup, if you go to the start page of the mocca calendar (e.g. via the "Applications" panel), the go to the wiki -edtior  
11:35 <ClemensR> you can see it contains a macro:   {{moccacalendar filter="wiki"/}}  
11:35 <ClemensR> this is what you need to add to display all events  
11:36 <ClemensR> you can also add it via WYSIWYG editor, but I prefer the wiki editor for that  
11:38 <ClemensR> if you do add it via WYSIWYG, the macro dialog for the "Mocca Calendar" should explain the different options  
11:42 <Evi\_> I see the {{moccacalendar filter="wiki"/}}. But how can I use it on the page where I want to display the calendar?  
11:42 <M-vmassol> has quit  
11:42 <M-yflory> has quit  
11:42 <M-jsimard> has quit  
11:42 <M-oren> has quit  
11:52 <ClemensR> well, you just insert it by editing the page in the wiki editor. it is just an ordinary macro  
11:52 \* ClemensR is afk now, need to run around for things  
11:52 <vmassol> or you come to Nantes on Friday and attend my XWiki 101 session: http://web2day.co/en/evenements/xwiki-101/ ;)  
11:53 <vmassol> (Nantes France that is)  
11:59 <M-jsimard> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <confusedcylon> Is there something special about the xwiki/bin/view/Main/ ? I have deny permissions for edit to a group and the user is still able to create pages :(  
12:03 <vmassol> maybe you denied only for the home pge and not children?  
12:03 <vmassol> gtg  
12:03 <vmassol> has quit  
12:05 <confusedcylon> it's page & children for sure  
12:08 <M-jsimard> has quit  
12:14 \* ClemensR is back  
12:17 <ClemensR> hm, when I try that, the user cannot add pages fro the start page  
12:17 <ClemensR> must go e.g to the sandbox to do that  
12:18 <ClemensR> maybe check with Admin tools if there are other permissions lurking somwhere ?  
12:29 <confusedcylon> I'm digging and nothing I do works :(. Only way is if I deny edit in Global Rights  
12:32 <confusedcylon> Rights on space "Main" says this group is denied edit...  
12:33 <ClemensR> hm, and the user has no "special" rights on the user level?  
12:34 <ClemensR> I have tested is with the XWikiAllGroup, maybe I should try another one  
12:34 <M-cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <confusedcylon> i'd be glad to give you teamviewer to take a look as its driving me mad  
12:36 <ClemensR> well, I do have a teamviewer running here, but I am not sure if I can fix the problem. I could have a look, though  
14:30 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:37 <ClemensR> note: we fixed confudescylon's problem off chat, but this shows that some common use case for permissions is not longer directly supported  
14:37 <ClemensR> I have created XWIKI-13506 for that issue. I guess it is a small chnage to bring that use case back, but I like to hear opinions, especially what else could break  
14:38 <ClemensR> um, xwikibot no longer sends links ... here is the link http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13506
